page.title: 06SOUTHSEA CASTLE
page.content: A Building of great interest is { {Southsea Castle} which was built to help Henry VIII's coastal defences in 1544.Henry VIII was standing on the steps of Southsea Castle viewing his fleet whe he saw his flagship {The {Mary Rose}go down. The castle was damaged by fire and restored in 1960. It was first opened to the public in 1967 and is now one of the most popular tourist attractions in Portsmouth with 134 000 visitors in 1984. It is open every day except Christmas day, Boxing Day and Easter Sunday, between 8.00a.m. and 5.30p.m.. Southsea Castle is used mainly as a museum but has interesting exhibitions at intervals.In{1986}actors will be performing the history of Southsea Castle in the grounds. We would recommend a visit.
